de.htwg_konstanz.ebus.framework.wholesaler.api.boa
Class UserBOA

java.lang.Object
  de.htwg_konstanz.ebus.framework.wholesaler.api.boa.UserBOA

public class UserBOA
extends java.lang.Object

The UserBOA provides common CRUD operations (Create Read Update Delete) for the user customer, supplier and internal entity.

The business object BOUserCustomer represents a user customer entity with it's common attributes like name, login, address or email.

The business object BOUserInternal represents a user internal entity with it's common attributes like name, login, address or email.

The business object BOUserSupplier represents a user supplier entity with it's common attributes like name, login, address or email.

The following example code shows how to create and persist a new user customer entity using the UserBOA. 

 // first of all load a existing country to build the address
 BOCountry country = CountryBOA.getInstance().findCountry(TEST_USER_CUSTOMER_COUNTRY_ISOCODE);
 if(country == null)
 {    
  // do something...
  // e.g. leave the procedure or throw an exception...
 }

 // second, create a address which must be unique for each user (addresses could not be shared)
 BOAddress address = new BOAddress();
 address.setStreet(TEST_USER_CUSTOMER_STREET);
 address.setZipcode(TEST_USER_CUSTOMER_ZIPCODE);
 address.setCity(TEST_USER_CUSTOMER_CITY);
 address.setCountry(country);
 AddressBOA.getInstance().saveOrUpdate(address);

 // third, load a existing customer
 BOCustomer customer = CustomerBOA.getInstance().findCustomerById(TEST_CUSTOMER_ID);
 if(customer == null)
 {    
  // do something...
  // e.g. leave the procedure or throw an exception...
 }

 // fourth, create and save the test customer
 BOUserCustomer userCustomer = new BOUserCustomer();
 userCustomer.setLogin(TEST_USER_CUSTOMER_LOGIN);
 userCustomer.setFirstname(TEST_USER_CUSTOMER_FIRSTNAME);
 userCustomer.setLastname(TEST_USER_CUSTOMER_LASTNAME);
 userCustomer.setAddress(address);
 userCustomer.setOrganization(customer);
 UserBOA.getInstance().saveOrUpdate(userCustomer);

 // important! store the userid for further use
 userId = userCustomer.getId();
The following example code shows how to load an existing user customer entity, using the UserBOA. 
 // load the created user
 BOUserCustomer userCustomer = UserBOA.getInstance().findUserCustomerById(userId);
 if(userCustomer == null)
 {    
  // do something...
  // e.g. leave the procedure or throw an exception...
 }
The following example code shows how to load and update an existing user customer entity, using the UserBOA. 
 // load the existing user
 BOUserCustomer userCustomer = UserBOA.getInstance().findUserCustomerById(userId);
 if(userCustomer == null)
 {    
  // do something...
  // e.g. leave the procedure or throw an exception...
 }
 
 // set different name values and update
 userCustomer.setFirstname(TEST_USER_CUSTOMER_UPDATED_FIRSTNAME);
 userCustomer.setLastname(TEST_USER_CUSTOMER_UPDATE_LASTNAME);
 UserBOA.getInstance().saveOrUpdateUserCustomer(userCustomer);
The following example code shows how to delete an existing user customer entity, using the UserBOA. 
 // load the existing user
 BOUserCustomer userCustomer = UserBOA.getInstance().findUserCustomerById(userId);
 if(userCustomer == null)
 {    
  // do something...
  // e.g. leave the procedure or throw an exception...
 }
 
 // delete the user
 UserBOA.getInstance().delete(userCustomer);

saveOrUpdate

public void saveOrUpdate(IBOUser user)

short description:
this method persists the given user object. If the user object does not exists in the database it will be created. Otherwise it will be updated.

Parameters:
user - the user object (any role)
